channel.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
channel.description:
More specifically, I'm wondering what a players quest steps/quest completed data looks like.
Say I had a character that was half way through dragon slayer, would it be stored like
QuestErrand 1 = 1 QuestErrand 2 = 1 QuestErrand 3 = 1 QuestErrand 4 = 1 QuestErrand 5 = 1 QuestErrand 6 = 0 QuestErrand 7 = 0 QuestErrand 8 = 0
Meaning he was on step 5. If he completed the quest would his quest data be stored as
QuestErrand 1 = 1 QuestErrand 2 = 1 QuestErrand 3 = 1 QuestErrand 4 = 1 QuestErrand 5 = 1 QuestErrand 6 = 1 QuestErrand 7 = 1 QuestErrand 8 = 1
Or is there times where if all steps are 1 it is just saved as a
QuestCompleted = 1 and all other data is erased.
Also, is it possible anyone has the source code or whatever a private servers code looks like for the quest; "Forgotten Tales of a Drunken Dwarf" more specifically the bit where you do the OPtional quest of going between Rin the Gardener and Elstan to deliver a letter.

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

Am I having a stroke? Since when is this the right section for this?
Why are there mods posting here?

Read full topic

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sini, post:16, topic:555055”]No but if youre using a 32 bit value for each variable you’re wasting a ton of space. Especially if you only need 1-4 bits to express the value. Come on David think about this.[/quote]what? wtf did i say about using 32 bits, i was talking about the configs (which are 32 bits, but with varbits they store multiple values in each config) that they send to the client that are for the quests, tied to the bits in the code that was posted.

Read full topic
item.source: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:17, topic:555055”]also sorta off-topic but usually production code isn’t as ideal as you would expect

i mean they literally talk about spaghetti themselves[/quote]
Example:

reddit

Osrs should be getting bank placeholders (assuming it passes the poll),Can we...

title

OSRS has the benefit of its own system for banks written from scratch, while being aware the problems within RS3's system.
[u]We would like to do an overhaul to banks[/u], hence Kelpie's recent survey. While we had a good idea of the big changes players wanted having that wishlist helps to design a system which can be expanded on in future.

Read full topic

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

No but if youre using a 32 bit value for each variable you’re wasting a ton of space. Especially if you only need 1-4 bits to express the value. Come on David think about this.

Read full topic

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2

@davidi2 wrote:

Because you have to use bits in order to serialize to bits

item.source: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

The reason they use bits is because it uses less space because they serialize the values. It is your temporary and permanent save state.

Read full topic
item.source: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

The reason they use the bits is because they send it directly to the client to do things like hiding/showing NPCs & objects.

You can send one packet (set config) with the status of the quest, and that can tell the client which npcs/objects are hidden and shown for that specific player.

Read full topic
item.source: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

A bitfield would be the ideal in my opinion, especially when there are collections (e.g.: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/BitSet.html) that allow for arbitrary-length bitfields.

Mind you, I’m sure many of their questions could just represent the bitfield using a 64 bit long due to having fewer than 64 quest waypoints.

Read full topic
item.source: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @Vidyannile Vidyannile
item.description:
@Vidyannile wrote:

Would these variables get erased on completion of the quest?

On completion would the quest just be flagged as 1 or something. They wouldnt store all these bits?

Sorry for the complete dumbass questions, just wanted to understand how like RS flag things as done

Read full topic
item.source: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Not exactly, that refers to a bit variable which is actually a range of bits and 6 is the value itself you are setting.

Say %BioErrand is from bits 0 to 5, and you want to set it to 6.

Mask = 2**(Max - Min) - 1 = 2**5 - 1 = 31
Value = (Value & ~(Mask << Min)) | (Value & Mask) << Min

You get the idea.

Read full topic
item.source: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Vidyannile, post:5, topic:555055”]You know in the biohazard sample quest

What is happening at the bottom where:

%BioErrand=setbit(%BioErrand, 6)
%BioErrand=setbit(%BioErrand, 3)

is this a shift register entering 6 and 3 in?[/quote]

Assuming %BioErrand is a 8 bit value:

c2trvaN.png1677×181

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @Vidyannile Vidyannile
item.description:
@Vidyannile wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:555055”]I don’t think they’ve ever written any explicit statements on how they save the data…

But, I can tell you that how you’re currently saving variables for a quest would be a waste of space.
You could at least save it like:

quest_name_progress = 0

and each stage it’s increment that value by 1.
If need be, you can also have a boolean saving for it being finished:

quest_name_progress = 0	0

The first 0 represents the progress. the second is the boolean. 0 if false, 1 if true.[/quote]

latest?cb=20140515184821719×537

Here is an extract from the source code for biohazard.

Safe to presume that (%Biohazard=12) is a incremented value for quest progress?

Read full topic
item.source: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General

item.title: Question - How Is Player Data Stored in OSRS/Runescape in General
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I don’t think they’ve ever written any explicit statements on how they save the data…

But, I can tell you that how you’re currently saving variables for a quest would be a waste of space.
You could at least save it like:

and each stage it’s increment that value by 1.
If need be, you can also have a boolean saving for it being finished:

The first 0 represents the progress. the second is the boolean. 0 if false, 1 if true.

Read full topic

More specifically, I’m wondering what a players quest steps/quest completed data looks like.

QuestErrand 2 = 1
QuestErrand 3 = 1
QuestErrand 4 = 1
QuestErrand 5 = 1
QuestErrand 6 = 1
QuestErrand 7 = 1
QuestErrand 8 = 1

Or is there times where if all steps are 1 it is just saved as a

QuestCompleted = 1 and all other data is erased.

Also, is it possible anyone has the source code or whatever a private servers code looks like for the quest; “Forgotten Tales of a Drunken Dwarf” more specifically the bit where you do the OPtional quest of going between Rin the Gardener and Elstan to deliver a letter.
